42 #define FILE_HASH_SIZE 1024
43 static shader_t* hashTable[FILE_HASH_SIZE];

45 #define MAX_SHADERTEXT_HASH 2048

48 /*
49 ================
50 return a hash value for the filename
51 ================
52 */
53 #ifdef __GNUCC__
54  #warning TODO: check if long is ok here
55 #endif
56 static long generateHashValue( const char *fname, const int size ) {
57  int i;
58  long hash;
59  char letter;
60 
61  hash = 0;
62  i = 0;
63  while (fname[i] != '\0') {
64  letter = tolower(fname[i]);
65  if (letter =='.') break; // don't include extension
66  if (letter =='\\') letter = '/'; // damn path names
67  if (letter == PATH_SEP) letter = '/'; // damn path names
68  hash+=(long)(letter)*(i+119);
69  i++;
70  }
71  hash = (hash ^ (hash >> 10) ^ (hash >> 20));
72  hash &= (size-1);
73  return hash;
74 }
75 
76 void R_RemapShader(const char *shaderName, const char *newShaderName, const char *timeOffset) {
77  char strippedName[MAX_QPATH];
78  int hash;
79  shader_t *sh, *sh2;
80  qhandle_t h;
81 
82  sh = R_FindShaderByName( shaderName );
83  if (sh == NULL || sh == tr.defaultShader) {
84  h = RE_RegisterShaderLightMap(shaderName, 0);
85  sh = R_GetShaderByHandle(h);
86  }
87  if (sh == NULL || sh == tr.defaultShader) {
88  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: R_RemapShader: shader %s not found\n", shaderName );
89  return;
90  }
91 
92  sh2 = R_FindShaderByName( newShaderName );
93  if (sh2 == NULL || sh2 == tr.defaultShader) {
94  h = RE_RegisterShaderLightMap(newShaderName, 0);
95  sh2 = R_GetShaderByHandle(h);
96  }
97 
98  if (sh2 == NULL || sh2 == tr.defaultShader) {
99  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: R_RemapShader: new shader %s not found\n", newShaderName );
100  return;
101  }
102 
103  // remap all the shaders with the given name
104  // even tho they might have different lightmaps
105  COM_StripExtension(shaderName, strippedName, sizeof(strippedName));
106  hash = generateHashValue(strippedName, FILE_HASH_SIZE);
107  for (sh = hashTable[hash]; sh; sh = sh->next) {
108  if (Q_stricmp(sh->name, strippedName) == 0) {
109  if (sh != sh2) {
110  sh->remappedShader = sh2;
111  } else {
112  sh->remappedShader = NULL;
113  }
114  }
115  }
116  if (timeOffset) {
117  sh2->timeOffset = atof(timeOffset);
118  }
119 }

121 /*
122 ===============
123 ParseVector
124 ===============
125 */
126 static qboolean ParseVector( char **text, int count, float *v ) {
127  char *token;
128  int i;
129 
130  // FIXME: spaces are currently required after parens, should change parseext...
131  token = COM_ParseExt( text, qfalse );
132  if ( strcmp( token, "(" ) ) {
133  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: missing parenthesis in shader '%s'\n", shader.name );
134  return qfalse;
135  }
136 
137  for ( i = 0 ; i < count ; i++ ) {
138  token = COM_ParseExt( text, qfalse );
139  if ( !token[0] ) {
140  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: missing vector element in shader '%s'\n", shader.name );
141  return qfalse;
142  }
143  v[i] = atof( token );
144  }
145 
146  token = COM_ParseExt( text, qfalse );
147  if ( strcmp( token, ")" ) ) {
148  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: missing parenthesis in shader '%s'\n", shader.name );
149  return qfalse;
150  }
151 
152  return qtrue;
153 }

156 /*
157 ===============
158 NameToAFunc
159 ===============
160 */
161 static unsigned NameToAFunc( const char *funcname )
162 {
163  if ( !Q_stricmp( funcname, "GT0" ) )
164  {
165  return GLS_ATEST_GT_0;
166  }
167  else if ( !Q_stricmp( funcname, "LT128" ) )
168  {
169  return GLS_ATEST_LT_80;
170  }
171  else if ( !Q_stricmp( funcname, "GE128" ) )
172  {
173  return GLS_ATEST_GE_80;
174  }
175 
176  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: invalid alphaFunc name '%s' in shader '%s'\n", funcname, shader.name );
177  return 0;
178 }

181 /*
182 ===============
183 NameToSrcBlendMode
184 ===============
185 */
186 static int NameToSrcBlendMode( const char *name )
187 {
188  if ( !Q_stricmp( name, "GL_ONE" ) )
189  {
190  return GLS_SRCBLEND_ONE;
191  }
192  else if ( !Q_stricmp( name, "GL_ZERO" ) )
193  {
194  return GLS_SRCBLEND_ZERO;
195  }
196  else if ( !Q_stricmp( name, "GL_DST_COLOR" ) )
197  {
198  return GLS_SRCBLEND_DST_COLOR;
199  }
200  else if ( !Q_stricmp( name, "GL_ONE_MINUS_DST_COLOR" ) )
201  {
202  return GLS_SRCBLEND_ONE_MINUS_DST_COLOR;
203  }
204  else if ( !Q_stricmp( name, "GL_SRC_ALPHA" ) )
205  {
206  return GLS_SRCBLEND_SRC_ALPHA;
207  }
208  else if ( !Q_stricmp( name, "GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA" ) )
209  {
210  return GLS_SRCBLEND_ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA;
211  }
212  else if ( !Q_stricmp( name, "GL_DST_ALPHA" ) )
213  {
214  return GLS_SRCBLEND_DST_ALPHA;
215  }
216  else if ( !Q_stricmp( name, "GL_ONE_MINUS_DST_ALPHA" ) )
217  {
218  return GLS_SRCBLEND_ONE_MINUS_DST_ALPHA;
219  }
220  else if ( !Q_stricmp( name, "GL_SRC_ALPHA_SATURATE" ) )
221  {
222  return GLS_SRCBLEND_ALPHA_SATURATE;
223  }
224 
225  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: unknown blend mode '%s' in shader '%s', substituting GL_ONE\n", name, shader.name );
226  return GLS_SRCBLEND_ONE;
227 }

229 /*
230 ===============
231 NameToDstBlendMode
232 ===============
233 */
234 static int NameToDstBlendMode( const char *name )
235 {
236  if ( !Q_stricmp( name, "GL_ONE" ) )

240  else if ( !Q_stricmp( name, "GL_ZERO" ) )
241  {
242  return GLS_DSTBLEND_ZERO;
243  }
244  else if ( !Q_stricmp( name, "GL_SRC_ALPHA" ) )
245  {
246  return GLS_DSTBLEND_SRC_ALPHA;
247  }
248  else if ( !Q_stricmp( name, "GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA" ) )
249  {
250  return GLS_DSTBLEND_ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA;
251  }
252  else if ( !Q_stricmp( name, "GL_DST_ALPHA" ) )
253  {
254  return GLS_DSTBLEND_DST_ALPHA;
255  }
256  else if ( !Q_stricmp( name, "GL_ONE_MINUS_DST_ALPHA" ) )
257  {
258  return GLS_DSTBLEND_ONE_MINUS_DST_ALPHA;
259  }
260  else if ( !Q_stricmp( name, "GL_SRC_COLOR" ) )
261  {
262  return GLS_DSTBLEND_SRC_COLOR;
263  }
264  else if ( !Q_stricmp( name, "GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_COLOR" ) )
265  {
266  return GLS_DSTBLEND_ONE_MINUS_SRC_COLOR;
267  }
268 
269  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: unknown blend mode '%s' in shader '%s', substituting GL_ONE\n", name, shader.name );
270  return GLS_DSTBLEND_ONE;
271 }

273 /*
274 ===============
275 NameToGenFunc
276 ===============
277 */
278 static genFunc_t NameToGenFunc( const char *funcname )
279 {
280  if ( !Q_stricmp( funcname, "sin" ) )
281  {
282  return GF_SIN;
283  }
284  else if ( !Q_stricmp( funcname, "square" ) )
285  {
286  return GF_SQUARE;
287  }
288  else if ( !Q_stricmp( funcname, "triangle" ) )
289  {
290  return GF_TRIANGLE;
291  }
292  else if ( !Q_stricmp( funcname, "sawtooth" ) )
293  {
294  return GF_SAWTOOTH;
295  }
296  else if ( !Q_stricmp( funcname, "inversesawtooth" ) )
297  {
298  return GF_INVERSE_SAWTOOTH;
299  }
300  else if ( !Q_stricmp( funcname, "noise" ) )
301  {
302  return GF_NOISE;
303  }
304 
305  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: invalid genfunc name '%s' in shader '%s'\n", funcname, shader.name );
306  return GF_SIN;
307 }

310 /*
311 ===================
312 ParseWaveForm
313 ===================
314 */
315 static void ParseWaveForm( char **text, waveForm_t *wave )
316 {
317  char *token;
318 
319  token = COM_ParseExt( text, qfalse );
320  if ( token[0] == 0 )
321  {
322  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: missing waveform parm in shader '%s'\n", shader.name );
323  return;
324  }
325  wave->func = NameToGenFunc( token );
326 
327  // BASE, AMP, PHASE, FREQ
328  token = COM_ParseExt( text, qfalse );
329  if ( token[0] == 0 )
330  {
331  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: missing waveform parm in shader '%s'\n", shader.name );
332  return;
333  }
334  wave->base = atof( token );
335 
336  token = COM_ParseExt( text, qfalse );
337  if ( token[0] == 0 )
338  {
339  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: missing waveform parm in shader '%s'\n", shader.name );
340  return;
341  }
342  wave->amplitude = atof( token );
343 
344  token = COM_ParseExt( text, qfalse );
345  if ( token[0] == 0 )
346  {
347  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: missing waveform parm in shader '%s'\n", shader.name );
348  return;
349  }
350  wave->phase = atof( token );
351 
352  token = COM_ParseExt( text, qfalse );
353  if ( token[0] == 0 )
354  {
355  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: missing waveform parm in shader '%s'\n", shader.name );
356  return;
357  }
358  wave->frequency = atof( token );
359 }

362 /*
363 ===================
364 ParseTexMod
365 ===================
366 */
367 static void ParseTexMod( char *_text, shaderStage_t *stage )
368 {
369  const char *token;
370  char **text = &_text;
371  texModInfo_t *tmi;
372 
373  if ( stage->bundle[0].numTexMods == TR_MAX_TEXMODS ) {
374  ri.Error( ERR_DROP, "ERROR: too many tcMod stages in shader '%s'", shader.name );
375  return;
376  }
377 
378  tmi = &stage->bundle[0].texMods[stage->bundle[0].numTexMods];
379  stage->bundle[0].numTexMods++;
380 
381  token = COM_ParseExt( text, qfalse );
382 
383  //
384  // turb
385  //
386  if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "turb" ) )
387  {
388  token = COM_ParseExt( text, qfalse );
389  if ( token[0] == 0 )
390  {
391  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: missing tcMod turb parms in shader '%s'\n", shader.name );
392  return;
393  }
394  tmi->wave.base = atof( token );
395  token = COM_ParseExt( text, qfalse );
396  if ( token[0] == 0 )
397  {
398  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: missing tcMod turb in shader '%s'\n", shader.name );
399  return;
400  }
401  tmi->wave.amplitude = atof( token );
402  token = COM_ParseExt( text, qfalse );
403  if ( token[0] == 0 )
404  {
405  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: missing tcMod turb in shader '%s'\n", shader.name );
406  return;
407  }
408  tmi->wave.phase = atof( token );
409  token = COM_ParseExt( text, qfalse );
410  if ( token[0] == 0 )
411  {
412  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: missing tcMod turb in shader '%s'\n", shader.name );
413  return;
414  }
415  tmi->wave.frequency = atof( token );
416 
417  tmi->type = TMOD_TURBULENT;
418  }
419  //
420  // scale
421  //
422  else if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "scale" ) )
423  {
424  token = COM_ParseExt( text, qfalse );
425  if ( token[0] == 0 )
426  {
427  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: missing scale parms in shader '%s'\n", shader.name );
428  return;
429  }
430  tmi->scale[0] = atof( token );
431 
432  token = COM_ParseExt( text, qfalse );
433  if ( token[0] == 0 )
434  {
435  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: missing scale parms in shader '%s'\n", shader.name );
436  return;
437  }
438  tmi->scale[1] = atof( token );
439  tmi->type = TMOD_SCALE;
440  }
441  //
442  // scroll
443  //
444  else if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "scroll" ) )
445  {
446  token = COM_ParseExt( text, qfalse );
447  if ( token[0] == 0 )
448  {
449  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: missing scale scroll parms in shader '%s'\n", shader.name );
450  return;
451  }
452  tmi->scroll[0] = atof( token );
453  token = COM_ParseExt( text, qfalse );
454  if ( token[0] == 0 )
455  {
456  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: missing scale scroll parms in shader '%s'\n", shader.name );
457  return;
458  }
459  tmi->scroll[1] = atof( token );
460  tmi->type = TMOD_SCROLL;
461  }
462  //
463  // stretch
464  //
465  else if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "stretch" ) )
466  {
467  token = COM_ParseExt( text, qfalse );
468  if ( token[0] == 0 )
469  {
470  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: missing stretch parms in shader '%s'\n", shader.name );
471  return;
472  }
473  tmi->wave.func = NameToGenFunc( token );
474 
475  token = COM_ParseExt( text, qfalse );
476  if ( token[0] == 0 )
477  {
478  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: missing stretch parms in shader '%s'\n", shader.name );
479  return;
480  }
481  tmi->wave.base = atof( token );
482 
483  token = COM_ParseExt( text, qfalse );
484  if ( token[0] == 0 )
485  {
486  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: missing stretch parms in shader '%s'\n", shader.name );
487  return;
488  }
489  tmi->wave.amplitude = atof( token );
490 
491  token = COM_ParseExt( text, qfalse );
492  if ( token[0] == 0 )
493  {
494  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: missing stretch parms in shader '%s'\n", shader.name );
495  return;
496  }
497  tmi->wave.phase = atof( token );
498 
499  token = COM_ParseExt( text, qfalse );
500  if ( token[0] == 0 )
501  {
502  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: missing stretch parms in shader '%s'\n", shader.name );
503  return;
504  }
505  tmi->wave.frequency = atof( token );
506 
507  tmi->type = TMOD_STRETCH;
508  }
509  //
510  // transform
511  //
512  else if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "transform" ) )
513  {
514  token = COM_ParseExt( text, qfalse );
515  if ( token[0] == 0 )
516  {
517  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: missing transform parms in shader '%s'\n", shader.name );
518  return;
519  }
520  tmi->matrix[0][0] = atof( token );
521 
522  token = COM_ParseExt( text, qfalse );
523  if ( token[0] == 0 )
524  {
525  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: missing transform parms in shader '%s'\n", shader.name );
526  return;
527  }
528  tmi->matrix[0][1] = atof( token );
529 
530  token = COM_ParseExt( text, qfalse );
531  if ( token[0] == 0 )
532  {
533  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: missing transform parms in shader '%s'\n", shader.name );
534  return;
535  }
536  tmi->matrix[1][0] = atof( token );
537 
538  token = COM_ParseExt( text, qfalse );
539  if ( token[0] == 0 )
540  {
541  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: missing transform parms in shader '%s'\n", shader.name );
542  return;
543  }
544  tmi->matrix[1][1] = atof( token );
545 
546  token = COM_ParseExt( text, qfalse );
547  if ( token[0] == 0 )
548  {
549  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: missing transform parms in shader '%s'\n", shader.name );
550  return;
551  }
552  tmi->translate[0] = atof( token );
553 
554  token = COM_ParseExt( text, qfalse );
555  if ( token[0] == 0 )
556  {
557  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: missing transform parms in shader '%s'\n", shader.name );
558  return;
559  }
560  tmi->translate[1] = atof( token );
561 
562  tmi->type = TMOD_TRANSFORM;
563  }
564  //
565  // rotate
566  //
567  else if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "rotate" ) )
568  {
569  token = COM_ParseExt( text, qfalse );
570  if ( token[0] == 0 )
571  {
572  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: missing tcMod rotate parms in shader '%s'\n", shader.name );
573  return;
574  }
575  tmi->rotateSpeed = atof( token );
576  tmi->type = TMOD_ROTATE;
577  }
578  //
579  // entityTranslate
580  //
581  else if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "entityTranslate" ) )
582  {
583  tmi->type = TMOD_ENTITY_TRANSLATE;
584  }
585  else
586  {
587  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: unknown tcMod '%s' in shader '%s'\n", token, shader.name );
588  }
589 }

591 
592 /*
593 ===================
594 ParseStage
595 ===================
596 */
597 static qboolean ParseStage( shaderStage_t *stage, char **text )
598 {
599  char *token;
600  char programName[MAX_QPATH];
601  char programVertexObjects[MAX_PROGRAM_OBJECTS][MAX_QPATH];
602  char programFragmentObjects[MAX_PROGRAM_OBJECTS][MAX_QPATH];
603  int numVertexObjects = 0;
604  int numFragmentObjects = 0;
605  int depthMaskBits = GLS_DEPTHMASK_TRUE, blendSrcBits = 0, blendDstBits = 0, atestBits = 0, depthFuncBits = 0;
606  qboolean depthMaskExplicit = qfalse;
607  qboolean stageMipmaps = !shader.noMipMaps;
608 
609  stage->active = qtrue;
610 
611  Com_Memset(programName, 0, sizeof(programName));
612 
613  while ( 1 )
614  {
615  token = COM_ParseExt( text, qtrue );
616  if ( !token[0] )
617  {
618  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: no matching '}' found\n" );
619  return qfalse;
620  }
621 
622  if ( token[0] == '}' )
623  {
624  if (programName[0]) {
625  if (!Q_stricmp(programName, "skip")) {
626  stage->program = tr.skipProgram;
627  } else {
628  if (!numVertexObjects) {
629  ri.Printf(PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: no 'vertexProgram' specified for 'program %s' in shader '%s'\n", programName, shader.name);
630  return qfalse;
631  }
632 
633  if (!numFragmentObjects) {
634  ri.Printf(PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: no 'fragmentProgram' specified for 'program %s' in shader '%s'\n", programName, shader.name);
635  return qfalse;
636  }
637 
638  stage->program = RE_GLSL_RegisterProgram(programName, (const char *)programVertexObjects, numVertexObjects, (const char *)programFragmentObjects, numFragmentObjects);
639  if (!stage->program) {
640  ri.Printf(PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: RE_GLSL_RegisterProgram failed for 'program %s' in shader '%s'\n", programName, shader.name);
641  return qfalse;
642  }
643  }
644  } else if (numVertexObjects) {
645  ri.Printf(PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: no 'program' specified for 'vertexProgram' in shader '%s'\n", shader.name);
646  return qfalse;
647  } else if (numFragmentObjects) {
648  ri.Printf(PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: no 'program' specified for 'fragmentProgram' in shader '%s'\n", shader.name);
649  return qfalse;
650  }
651 
652  break;
653  }
654  //
655  // program <name>
656  //
657  else if (!Q_stricmp(token, "program")) {
658  token = COM_ParseExt(text, qfalse);
659 
660  if (!vertexShaders)
661  continue;
662 
663  if (!token[0]) {
664  ri.Printf(PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: missing parameter for 'program' keyword in shader '%s'\n", shader.name);
665  return qfalse;
666  }
667 
668  Q_strncpyz(programName, token, sizeof(programName));
669  }
670  //
671  // vertexProgram <path1> .... <pathN>
672  //
673  else if (!Q_stricmp(token, "vertexProgram")) {
674  token = COM_ParseExt(text, qfalse);
675 
676  if (!vertexShaders) {
677  while (token[0])
678  token = COM_ParseExt(text, qfalse);
679 
680  continue;
681  }
682 
683  if (!token[0]) {
684  ri.Printf(PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: missing parameter(s) for 'vertexProgram' keyword in shader '%s'\n", shader.name);
685  return qfalse;
686  }
687 
688  // parse up to MAX_PROGRAM_OBJECTS files
689  for(;;) {
690  if (numVertexObjects < MAX_PROGRAM_OBJECTS) {
691  Q_strncpyz(programVertexObjects[numVertexObjects], token, sizeof(programVertexObjects[numVertexObjects]));
692  numVertexObjects++;
693  } else {
694  ri.Printf(PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: Too many parameters for 'vertexProgram' keyword in shader '%s'\n", shader.name);
695  return qfalse;
696  }
697 
698  token = COM_ParseExt(text, qfalse);
699  if (!token[0])
700  break;
701  }
702  }
703  //
704  // fragmentProgram <path1> .... <pathN>
705  //
706  else if (!Q_stricmp(token, "fragmentProgram")) {
707  token = COM_ParseExt(text, qfalse);
708 
709  if (!vertexShaders) {
710  while (token[0])
711  token = COM_ParseExt(text, qfalse);
712 
713  continue;
714  }
715 
716  if (!token[0]) {
717  ri.Printf(PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: missing parameter(s) for 'fragmentProgram' keyword in shader '%s'\n", shader.name);
718  return qfalse;
719  }
720 
721  // parse up to MAX_PROGRAM_OBJECTS files
722  for(;;) {
723  if (numFragmentObjects < MAX_PROGRAM_OBJECTS) {
724  Q_strncpyz(programFragmentObjects[numFragmentObjects], token, sizeof(programFragmentObjects[numFragmentObjects]));
725  numFragmentObjects++;
726  } else {
727  ri.Printf(PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: Too many parameters for 'fragmentProgram' keyword in shader '%s'\n", shader.name);
728  return qfalse;
729  }
730 
731  token = COM_ParseExt(text, qfalse);
732  if (!token[0])
733  break;
734  }
735  }
736  else if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "mipOffset" ) ){
737  token = COM_ParseExt(text,qfalse);
738  stage->mipBias = atoi(token);
739  }
740  else if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "nomipmaps" ) ){
741  stageMipmaps = qfalse;
742  }
743  //
744  // map <name>
745  //
746  else if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "map" ) )
747  {
748  token = COM_ParseExt( text, qfalse );
749  if ( !token[0] )
750  {
751  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: missing parameter for 'map' keyword in shader '%s'\n", shader.name );
752  return qfalse;
753  }
754 
755  if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "$whiteimage" ) )
756  {
757  stage->bundle[0].image[0] = tr.whiteImage;
758  continue;
759  }
760  else if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "$lightmap" ) )
761  {
762  stage->bundle[0].isLightmap = qtrue;
763  if ( shader.lightmapIndex < 0 ) {
764  stage->bundle[0].image[0] = tr.whiteImage;
765  } else {
766  stage->bundle[0].image[0] = tr.lightmaps[shader.lightmapIndex];
767  }
768  continue;
769  }
770  else
771  {
772  stage->bundle[0].image[0] = R_FindImageFile( token, stageMipmaps, !shader.noPicMip, GL_REPEAT);
773  if ( !stage->bundle[0].image[0] )
774  {
775  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: R_FindImageFile could not find '%s' in shader '%s'\n", token, shader.name );
776  return qfalse;
777  }
778  }
779  }
780  //
781  // map2 <name>
782  //
783  else if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "map2" ) )

1738  stage->isDetail = qtrue;

1740  //
1741  // blendfunc <srcFactor> <dstFactor>
1742  // or blendfunc <add|filter|blend>
1743  //
1744  else if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "blendfunc" ) )
1745  {
1746  token = COM_ParseExt( text, qfalse );
1747  if ( token[0] == 0 )
1748  {
1749  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: missing parm for blendFunc in shader '%s'\n", shader.name );
1750  continue;
1751  }
1752  // check for "simple" blends first
1753  if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "add" ) ) {
1754  blendSrcBits = GLS_SRCBLEND_ONE;
1755  blendDstBits = GLS_DSTBLEND_ONE;
1756  } else if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "filter" ) ) {
1757  blendSrcBits = GLS_SRCBLEND_DST_COLOR;
1758  blendDstBits = GLS_DSTBLEND_ZERO;
1759  } else if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "blend" ) ) {
1760  blendSrcBits = GLS_SRCBLEND_SRC_ALPHA;
1761  blendDstBits = GLS_DSTBLEND_ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA;
1762  } else {
1763  // complex double blends
1764  blendSrcBits = NameToSrcBlendMode( token );
1765 
1766  token = COM_ParseExt( text, qfalse );
1767  if ( token[0] == 0 )
1768  {
1769  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: missing parm for blendFunc in shader '%s'\n", shader.name );
1770  continue;
1771  }
1772  blendDstBits = NameToDstBlendMode( token );
1773  }
1774 
1775  // clear depth mask for blended surfaces
1776  if ( !depthMaskExplicit )
1777  {
1778  depthMaskBits = 0;
1779  }
1780  }
1781  //
1782  // rgbGen
1783  //
1784  else if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "rgbGen" ) )
1785  {
1786  token = COM_ParseExt( text, qfalse );

1788  {
1789  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: missing parameters for rgbGen in shader '%s'\n", shader.name );
1790  continue;
1791  }
1792 
1793  if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "wave" ) )
1794  {
1795  ParseWaveForm( text, &stage->rgbWave );
1796  stage->rgbGen = CGEN_WAVEFORM;
1797  }
1798  else if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "const" ) )
1799  {
1800  vec3_t color;
1801 
1802  ParseVector( text, 3, color );
1803  stage->constantColor[0] = 255 * color[0];
1804  stage->constantColor[1] = 255 * color[1];
1805  stage->constantColor[2] = 255 * color[2];
1806 
1807  stage->rgbGen = CGEN_CONST;
1808  }
1809  else if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "identity" ) )
1810  {
1811  stage->rgbGen = CGEN_IDENTITY;
1812  }
1813  else if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "identityLighting" ) )
1814  {
1815  stage->rgbGen = CGEN_IDENTITY_LIGHTING;
1816  }
1817  else if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "entity" ) )
1818  {
1819  stage->rgbGen = CGEN_ENTITY;
1820  }
1821  else if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "oneMinusEntity" ) )
1822  {
1823  stage->rgbGen = CGEN_ONE_MINUS_ENTITY;
1824  }
1825  else if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "vertex" ) )
1826  {
1827  stage->rgbGen = CGEN_VERTEX;
1828  if ( stage->alphaGen == 0 ) {
1829  stage->alphaGen = AGEN_VERTEX;
1830  }
1831  }
1832  else if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "exactVertex" ) )
1833  {
1834  stage->rgbGen = CGEN_EXACT_VERTEX;
1835  }
1836  else if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "lightingDiffuse" ) )
1837  {
1838  stage->rgbGen = CGEN_LIGHTING_DIFFUSE;
1839  }
1840  else if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "lightingUniform" ) )
1841  {
1842  stage->rgbGen = CGEN_LIGHTING_UNIFORM;
1843  }
1844  else if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "lightingDynamic" ) )
1845  {
1846  stage->rgbGen = CGEN_LIGHTING_DYNAMIC;
1847  }
1848  else if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "oneMinusVertex" ) )
1849  {
1850  stage->rgbGen = CGEN_ONE_MINUS_VERTEX;
1851  }
1852  else
1853  {
1854  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: unknown rgbGen parameter '%s' in shader '%s'\n", token, shader.name );
1855  continue;
1856  }
1857  }
1858  //
1859  // alphaGen
1860  //
1861  else if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "alphaGen" ) )

1873  stage->alphaGen = AGEN_WAVEFORM;
1874  }
1875  else if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "const" ) )
1876  {
1877  token = COM_ParseExt( text, qfalse );
1878  stage->constantColor[3] = 255 * atof( token );
1879  stage->alphaGen = AGEN_CONST;
1880  }
1881  else if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "identity" ) )
1882  {
1883  stage->alphaGen = AGEN_IDENTITY;
1884  }
1885  else if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "entity" ) )
1886  {
1887  stage->alphaGen = AGEN_ENTITY;
1888  }
1889  else if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "oneMinusEntity" ) )
1890  {
1891  stage->alphaGen = AGEN_ONE_MINUS_ENTITY;
1892  }
1893  else if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "vertex" ) )
1894  {
1895  stage->alphaGen = AGEN_VERTEX;
1896  }
1897  else if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "lightingSpecular" ) )
1898  {
1899  stage->alphaGen = AGEN_LIGHTING_SPECULAR;
1900  }
1901  else if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "oneMinusVertex" ) )
1902  {
1903  stage->alphaGen = AGEN_ONE_MINUS_VERTEX;
1904  }
1905  else if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "portal" ) )
1906  {
1907  stage->alphaGen = AGEN_PORTAL;
1908  token = COM_ParseExt( text, qfalse );
1909  if ( token[0] == 0 )
1910  {
1911  shader.portalRange = 256;
1912  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: missing range parameter for alphaGen portal in shader '%s', defaulting to 256\n", shader.name );
1913  }
1914  else
1915  {
1916  shader.portalRange = atof( token );
1917  }
1918  }
1919  else
1920  {
1921  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: unknown alphaGen parameter '%s' in shader '%s'\n", token, shader.name );
1922  continue;
1923  }
1924  }
1925  //
1926  // tcGen <function>
1927  //
1928  else if ( !Q_stricmp(token, "texgen") || !Q_stricmp( token, "tcGen" ) )
1929  {
1930  token = COM_ParseExt( text, qfalse );
1931  if ( token[0] == 0 )
1932  {
1933  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: missing texgen parm in shader '%s'\n", shader.name );
1934  continue;
1935  }
1936 
1937  if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "environment" ) )
1938  {
1939  stage->bundle[0].tcGen = TCGEN_ENVIRONMENT_MAPPED;
1940  }
1941  else if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "cel" ) )
1942  {
1943  stage->bundle[0].tcGen = TCGEN_ENVIRONMENT_CELSHADE_MAPPED;
1944  }
1945  else if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "lightmap" ) )
1946  {
1947  stage->bundle[0].tcGen = TCGEN_LIGHTMAP;
1948  }
1949  else if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "texture" ) || !Q_stricmp( token, "base" ) )
1950  {
1951  stage->bundle[0].tcGen = TCGEN_TEXTURE;
1952  }
1953  else if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "vector" ) )
1954  {
1955  ParseVector( text, 3, stage->bundle[0].tcGenVectors[0] );
1956  ParseVector( text, 3, stage->bundle[0].tcGenVectors[1] );
1957 
1958  stage->bundle[0].tcGen = TCGEN_VECTOR;
1959  }
1960  else
1961  {
1962  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: unknown texgen parm in shader '%s'\n", shader.name );
1963  }
1964  }
1965  //
1966  // tcMod <type> <...>
1967  //
1968  else if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "tcMod" ) )
1969  {
1970  char buffer[1024] = "";
1971 
1972  while ( 1 )
1973  {
1974  token = COM_ParseExt( text, qfalse );
1975  if ( token[0] == 0 )
1976  break;
1977  strcat( buffer, token );
1978  strcat( buffer, " " );
1979  }
1980 
1981  ParseTexMod( buffer, stage );
1982 
1983  continue;
1984  }
1985  //
1986  // depthmask
1987  //
1988  else if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "depthwrite" ) )
1989  {
1990  depthMaskBits = GLS_DEPTHMASK_TRUE;
1991  depthMaskExplicit = qtrue;
1992 
1993  continue;
1994  }
1995  else
1996  {
1997  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: unknown parameter '%s' in shader '%s'\n", token, shader.name );
1998  return qfalse;
1999  }
2000  }
2001 
2002  //
2003  // if cgen isn't explicitly specified, use either identity or identitylighting
2004  //
2005  if ( stage->rgbGen == CGEN_BAD ) {
2006  if ( blendSrcBits == 0 ||
2007  blendSrcBits == GLS_SRCBLEND_ONE ||
2008  blendSrcBits == GLS_SRCBLEND_SRC_ALPHA ) {
2009  stage->rgbGen = CGEN_IDENTITY_LIGHTING;
2010  } else {
2011  stage->rgbGen = CGEN_IDENTITY;
2012  }
2013  }
2014 
2015 
2016  //
2017  // implicitly assume that a GL_ONE GL_ZERO blend mask disables blending
2018  //
2019  if ( ( blendSrcBits == GLS_SRCBLEND_ONE ) &&
2020  ( blendDstBits == GLS_DSTBLEND_ZERO ) )
2021  {
2022  blendDstBits = blendSrcBits = 0;
2023  depthMaskBits = GLS_DEPTHMASK_TRUE;
2024  }
2025 
2026  // decide which agens we can skip
2027  if ( stage->alphaGen == AGEN_IDENTITY ) {
2028  if ( stage->rgbGen == CGEN_IDENTITY
2029  || stage->rgbGen == CGEN_LIGHTING_DIFFUSE
2030  || stage->rgbGen == CGEN_LIGHTING_UNIFORM
2031  || stage->rgbGen == CGEN_LIGHTING_DYNAMIC) {
2032  stage->alphaGen = AGEN_SKIP;
2033  }
2034  }
2035 
2036  //
2037  // compute state bits
2038  //
2039  stage->stateBits = depthMaskBits |
2040  blendSrcBits | blendDstBits |
2041  atestBits |
2042  depthFuncBits;
2043 
2044  return qtrue;
2045 }
2046 
2047 /*
2048 ===============
2049 ParseDeform
2050 
2051 deformVertexes wave <spread> <waveform> <base> <amplitude> <phase> <frequency>
2052 deformVertexes normal <frequency> <amplitude>
2053 deformVertexes move <vector> <waveform> <base> <amplitude> <phase> <frequency>
2054 deformVertexes bulge <bulgeWidth> <bulgeHeight> <bulgeSpeed>
2055 deformVertexes projectionShadow
2056 deformVertexes autoSprite
2057 deformVertexes autoSprite2
2058 deformVertexes text[0-7]
2059 ===============
2060 */
2061 static void ParseDeform( char **text ) {
2062  char *token;
2063  deformStage_t *ds;
2064 
2065  token = COM_ParseExt( text, qfalse );
2066  if ( token[0] == 0 )
2067  {
2068  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: missing deform parm in shader '%s'\n", shader.name );
2069  return;
2070  }
2071 
2072  if ( shader.numDeforms == MAX_SHADER_DEFORMS ) {
2073  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: MAX_SHADER_DEFORMS in '%s'\n", shader.name );
2074  return;
2075  }
2076 
2077  ds = &shader.deforms[ shader.numDeforms ];
2078  shader.numDeforms++;
2079 
2080  if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "projectionShadow" ) ) {
2081  ds->deformation = DEFORM_PROJECTION_SHADOW;
2082  return;
2083  }
2084 
2085  if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "autosprite" ) ) {
2086  ds->deformation = DEFORM_AUTOSPRITE;
2087  return;
2088  }
2089 
2090  if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "autosprite2" ) ) {
2091  ds->deformation = DEFORM_AUTOSPRITE2;
2092  return;
2093  }
2094 
2095  if ( !Q_stricmpn( token, "text", 4 ) ) {
2096  int n;
2097 
2098  n = token[4] - '0';
2099  if ( n < 0 || n > 7 ) {
2100  n = 0;
2101  }
2102  ds->deformation = DEFORM_TEXT0 + n;
2103  return;
2104  }
2105 
2106  if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "bulge" ) ) {
2107  token = COM_ParseExt( text, qfalse );
2108  if ( token[0] == 0 )
2109  {
2110  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: missing deformVertexes bulge parm in shader '%s'\n", shader.name );
2111  return;
2112  }
2113  ds->bulgeWidth = atof( token );
2114 
2115  token = COM_ParseExt( text, qfalse );
2116  if ( token[0] == 0 )
2117  {
2118  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: missing deformVertexes bulge parm in shader '%s'\n", shader.name );
2119  return;
2120  }
2121  ds->bulgeHeight = atof( token );
2122 
2123  token = COM_ParseExt( text, qfalse );
2124  if ( token[0] == 0 )
2125  {
2126  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: missing deformVertexes bulge parm in shader '%s'\n", shader.name );
2127  return;
2128  }
2129  ds->bulgeSpeed = atof( token );
2130 
2131  ds->deformation = DEFORM_BULGE;
2132  return;
2133  }
2134 
2135  if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "wave" ) )
2136  {
2137  token = COM_ParseExt( text, qfalse );
2138  if ( token[0] == 0 )
2139  {
2140  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: missing deformVertexes parm in shader '%s'\n", shader.name );
2141  return;
2142  }
2143 
2144  if ( atof( token ) != 0 )
2145  {
2146  ds->deformationSpread = 1.0f / atof( token );
2147  }
2148  else
2149  {
2150  ds->deformationSpread = 100.0f;
2151  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: illegal div value of 0 in deformVertexes command for shader '%s'\n", shader.name );
2152  }
2153 
2154  ParseWaveForm( text, &ds->deformationWave );
2155  ds->deformation = DEFORM_WAVE;
2156  return;
2157  }
2158 
2159  if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "normal" ) )
2160  {
2161  token = COM_ParseExt( text, qfalse );
2162  if ( token[0] == 0 )
2163  {
2164  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: missing deformVertexes parm in shader '%s'\n", shader.name );
2165  return;
2166  }
2167  ds->deformationWave.amplitude = atof( token );
2168 
2169  token = COM_ParseExt( text, qfalse );
2170  if ( token[0] == 0 )
2171  {
2172  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: missing deformVertexes parm in shader '%s'\n", shader.name );
2173  return;
2174  }
2175  ds->deformationWave.frequency = atof( token );
2176 
2177  ds->deformation = DEFORM_NORMALS;
2178  return;
2179  }
2180 
2181  if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "move" ) ) {
2182  int i;
2183 
2184  for ( i = 0 ; i < 3 ; i++ ) {
2185  token = COM_ParseExt( text, qfalse );
2186  if ( token[0] == 0 ) {
2187  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: missing deformVertexes parm in shader '%s'\n", shader.name );
2188  return;
2189  }
2190  ds->moveVector[i] = atof( token );
2191  }
2192 
2193  ParseWaveForm( text, &ds->deformationWave );
2194  ds->deformation = DEFORM_MOVE;
2195  return;
2196  }
2197 
2198  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: unknown deformVertexes subtype '%s' found in shader '%s'\n", token, shader.name );
2199 }
2200

2202 /*
2203 ===============
2204 ParseSkyParms
2205 
2206 skyParms <outerbox> <cloudheight> <innerbox>
2207 ===============
2208 */
2209 static void ParseSkyParms( char **text ) {
2210  char *token;
2211  static char *suf[6] = {"rt", "bk", "lf", "ft", "up", "dn"};
2212  char pathname[MAX_QPATH];
2213  int i;
2214 
2215  // outerbox
2216  token = COM_ParseExt( text, qfalse );
2217  if ( token[0] == 0 ) {
2218  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: 'skyParms' missing parameter in shader '%s'\n", shader.name );
2219  return;
2220  }
2221  if ( strcmp( token, "-" ) ) {
2222  for (i=0 ; i<6 ; i++) {
2223  Com_sprintf( pathname, sizeof(pathname), "%s_%s.tga"
2224  , token, suf[i] );
2225  shader.sky.outerbox[i] = R_FindImageFile( ( char * ) pathname, qtrue, qtrue, GL_CLAMP_TO_EDGE );
2226 
2227  if ( !shader.sky.outerbox[i] ) {
2228  shader.sky.outerbox[i] = tr.defaultImage;
2229  }
2230  }
2231  }
2232 
2233  // cloudheight
2234  token = COM_ParseExt( text, qfalse );
2235  if ( token[0] == 0 ) {
2236  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: 'skyParms' missing parameter in shader '%s'\n", shader.name );
2237  return;
2238  }
2239  shader.sky.cloudHeight = atof( token );
2240  if ( !shader.sky.cloudHeight ) {
2241  shader.sky.cloudHeight = 512;
2242  }
2243  R_InitSkyTexCoords( shader.sky.cloudHeight );
2244 
2245 
2246  // innerbox
2247  token = COM_ParseExt( text, qfalse );
2248  if ( token[0] == 0 ) {
2249  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: 'skyParms' missing parameter in shader '%s'\n", shader.name );
2250  return;
2251  }
2252  if ( strcmp( token, "-" ) ) {
2253  for (i=0 ; i<6 ; i++) {
2254  Com_sprintf( pathname, sizeof(pathname), "%s_%s.tga"
2255  , token, suf[i] );
2256  shader.sky.innerbox[i] = R_FindImageFile( ( char * ) pathname, qtrue, qtrue, GL_REPEAT );
2257  if ( !shader.sky.innerbox[i] ) {
2258  shader.sky.innerbox[i] = tr.defaultImage;
2259  }
2260  }
2261  }
2262 
2263  shader.isSky = qtrue;
2264 }

2267 /*
2268 =================
2269 ParseSort
2270 =================
2271 */
2272 void ParseSort( char **text ) {
2273  char *token;
2274 
2275  token = COM_ParseExt( text, qfalse );
2276  if ( token[0] == 0 ) {
2277  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: missing sort parameter in shader '%s'\n", shader.name );
2278  return;
2279  }
2280 
2281  if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "portal" ) ) {
2282  shader.sort = SS_PORTAL;
2283  } else if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "sky" ) ) {
2284  shader.sort = SS_ENVIRONMENT;
2285  } else if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "opaque" ) ) {
2286  shader.sort = SS_OPAQUE;
2287  }else if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "decal" ) ) {
2288  shader.sort = SS_DECAL;
2289  } else if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "seeThrough" ) ) {
2290  shader.sort = SS_SEE_THROUGH;
2291  } else if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "banner" ) ) {
2292  shader.sort = SS_BANNER;
2293  } else if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "additive" ) ) {
2294  shader.sort = SS_BLEND1;
2295  } else if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "nearest" ) ) {
2296  shader.sort = SS_NEAREST;
2297  } else if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "underwater" ) ) {
2298  shader.sort = SS_UNDERWATER;
2299  } else {
2300  shader.sort = atof( token );
2301  }
2302 }

2357 /*
2358 ===============
2359 ParseSurfaceParm
2360 
2361 surfaceparm <name>
2362 ===============
2363 */
2364 static void ParseSurfaceParm( char **text ) {
2365  char *token;
2366  int numInfoParms = ARRAY_LEN( infoParms );
2367  int i;
2368 
2369  token = COM_ParseExt( text, qfalse );
2370  for ( i = 0 ; i < numInfoParms ; i++ ) {
2371  if ( !Q_stricmp( token, infoParms[i].name ) ) {
2372  shader.surfaceFlags |= infoParms[i].surfaceFlags;
2373  shader.contentFlags |= infoParms[i].contents;
2374 #if 0
2375  if ( infoParms[i].clearSolid ) {
2376  si->contents &= ~CONTENTS_SOLID;
2377  }
2378 #endif
2379  break;
2380  }
2381  }
2382 }
2383 
2384 /*
2385 =================
2386 ParseShader
2387 
2388 The current text pointer is at the explicit text definition of the
2389 shader. Parse it into the global shader variable. Later functions
2390 will optimize it.
2391 =================
2392 */
2393 static qboolean ParseShader( char **text )
2394 {
2395  char *token;
2396  int s;
2397 
2398  s = 0;
2399 
2400  token = COM_ParseExt( text, qtrue );
2401  if ( token[0] != '{' )
2402  {
2403  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: expecting '{', found '%s' instead in shader '%s'\n", token, shader.name );
2404  return qfalse;
2405  }
2406 
2407  while ( 1 )
2408  {
2409  token = COM_ParseExt( text, qtrue );
2410  if ( !token[0] )
2411  {
2412  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: no concluding '}' in shader %s\n", shader.name );
2413  return qfalse;
2414  }
2415 
2416  // end of shader definition
2417  if ( token[0] == '}' )
2418  {
2419  break;
2420  }
2421  // stage definition
2422  else if ( token[0] == '{' )
2423  {
2424  if ( s >= MAX_SHADER_STAGES ) {
2425  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: too many stages in shader %s\n", shader.name );
2426  return qfalse;
2427  }
2428 
2429  if ( !ParseStage( &stages[s], text ) )
2430  {
2431  return qfalse;
2432  }
2433  stages[s].active = qtrue;
2434  s++;
2435 
2436  continue;
2437  }
2438  // skip stuff that only the QuakeEdRadient needs
2439  else if ( !Q_stricmpn( token, "qer", 3 ) ) {
2440  SkipRestOfLine( text );
2441  continue;
2442  }
2443  // sun parms
2444  else if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "q3map_sun" ) ) {
2445  float a, b;
2446 
2447  token = COM_ParseExt( text, qfalse );
2448  tr.sunLight[0] = atof( token );
2449  token = COM_ParseExt( text, qfalse );
2450  tr.sunLight[1] = atof( token );
2451  token = COM_ParseExt( text, qfalse );
2452  tr.sunLight[2] = atof( token );
2453 
2454  VectorNormalize( tr.sunLight );
2455 
2456  token = COM_ParseExt( text, qfalse );
2457  a = atof( token );
2458  VectorScale( tr.sunLight, a, tr.sunLight);
2459 
2460  token = COM_ParseExt( text, qfalse );
2461  a = atof( token );
2462  a = a / 180 * M_PI;
2463 
2464  token = COM_ParseExt( text, qfalse );
2465  b = atof( token );
2466  b = b / 180 * M_PI;
2467 
2468  tr.sunDirection[0] = cos( a ) * cos( b );
2469  tr.sunDirection[1] = sin( a ) * cos( b );
2470  tr.sunDirection[2] = sin( b );
2471  }
2472  else if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "deformVertexes" ) ) {
2473  ParseDeform( text );
2474  continue;
2475  }
2476  else if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "tesssize" ) ) {
2477  SkipRestOfLine( text );
2478  continue;
2479  }
2480  else if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "clampTime" ) ) {
2481  token = COM_ParseExt( text, qfalse );
2482  if (token[0]) {
2483  shader.clampTime = atof(token);
2484  }
2485  }
2486  // skip stuff that only the q3map needs
2487  else if ( !Q_stricmpn( token, "q3map", 5 ) ) {
2488  SkipRestOfLine( text );
2489  continue;
2490  }
2491  // skip stuff that only q3map or the server needs
2492  else if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "surfaceParm" ) ) {
2493  ParseSurfaceParm( text );
2494  continue;
2495  }
2496  // no mip maps
2497  else if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "nomipmaps" ) )
2498  {
2499  shader.noMipMaps = qtrue;
2500  shader.noPicMip = qtrue;
2501  continue;
2502  }
2503  // no picmip adjustment
2504  else if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "nopicmip" ) )
2505  {
2506  shader.noPicMip = qtrue;
2507  continue;
2508  }
2509  // polygonOffset
2510  else if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "polygonOffset" ) )
2511  {
2512  shader.polygonOffset = qtrue;
2513  continue;
2514  }
2515  // entityMergable, allowing sprite surfaces from multiple entities
2516  // to be merged into one batch. This is a savings for smoke
2517  // puffs and blood, but can't be used for anything where the
2518  // shader calcs (not the surface function) reference the entity color or scroll
2519  else if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "entityMergable" ) )
2520  {
2521  shader.entityMergable = qtrue;
2522  continue;
2523  }
2524 
2525  // <-- RiO_Outlines: should shader have outlines?
2526  else if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "outlines" ) ) {
2527  shader.hasOutlines = qtrue;
2528  continue;
2529  }
2530  // -->
2531 
2532  // fogParms
2533  else if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "fogParms" ) )
2534  {
2535  if ( !ParseVector( text, 3, shader.fogParms.color ) ) {
2536  return qfalse;
2537  }
2538 
2539  token = COM_ParseExt( text, qfalse );
2540  if ( !token[0] )
2541  {
2542  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: missing parm for 'fogParms' keyword in shader '%s'\n", shader.name );
2543  continue;
2544  }
2545  shader.fogParms.depthForOpaque = atof( token );
2546 
2547  // skip any old gradient directions
2548  SkipRestOfLine( text );
2549  continue;
2550  }
2551  // portal
2552  else if ( !Q_stricmp(token, "portal") )
2553  {
2554  shader.sort = SS_PORTAL;
2555  continue;
2556  }
2557  // skyparms <cloudheight> <outerbox> <innerbox>
2558  else if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "skyparms" ) )
2559  {
2560  ParseSkyParms( text );
2561  continue;
2562  }
2563  // light <value> determines flaring in q3map, not needed here
2564  else if ( !Q_stricmp(token, "light") )
2565  {
2566  token = COM_ParseExt( text, qfalse );
2567  continue;
2568  }
2569  // cull <face>
2570  else if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "cull") )
2571  {
2572  token = COM_ParseExt( text, qfalse );
2573  if ( token[0] == 0 )
2574  {
2575  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: missing cull parms in shader '%s'\n", shader.name );
2576  continue;
2577  }
2578 
2579  if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "none" ) || !Q_stricmp( token, "twosided" ) || !Q_stricmp( token, "disable" ) )
2580  {
2581  shader.cullType = CT_TWO_SIDED;
2582  }
2583  else if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "back" ) || !Q_stricmp( token, "backside" ) || !Q_stricmp( token, "backsided" ) )
2584  {
2585  shader.cullType = CT_BACK_SIDED;
2586  }
2587  else
2588  {
2589  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: invalid cull parm '%s' in shader '%s'\n", token, shader.name );
2590  }
2591  continue;
2592  }
2593  // sort
2594  else if ( !Q_stricmp( token, "sort" ) )
2595  {
2596  ParseSort( text );
2597  continue;
2598  }
2599  else
2600  {
2601  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: unknown general shader parameter '%s' in '%s'\n", token, shader.name );
2602  return qfalse;
2603  }
2604  }
2605 
2606  //
2607  // ignore shaders that don't have any stages, unless it is a sky or fog
2608  //
2609  if ( s == 0 && !shader.isSky && !(shader.contentFlags & CONTENTS_FOG ) ) {
2610  return qfalse;
2611  }
2612 
2613  shader.explicitlyDefined = qtrue;
2614 
2615  return qtrue;
2616 }
2617 
2618 /*
2619 ========================================================================================
2620 
2621 SHADER OPTIMIZATION AND FOGGING
2622 
2623 ========================================================================================
2624 */

2626 /*
2627 ===================
2628 ComputeStageIteratorFunc
2629 
2630 See if we can use on of the simple fastpath stage functions,
2631 otherwise set to the generic stage function
2632 ===================
2633 */
2634 static void ComputeStageIteratorFunc( void )
2635 {
2636  if (vertexShaders)
2637  shader.optimalStageIteratorFunc = RB_GLSL_StageIteratorGeneric;
2638  else
2639  shader.optimalStageIteratorFunc = RB_StageIteratorGeneric;
2640 
2641  //
2642  // see if this should go into the sky path
2643  //
2644  if ( shader.isSky )
2645  {
2646  if (vertexShaders)
2647  shader.optimalStageIteratorFunc = RB_GLSL_StageIteratorSky;
2648  else
2649  shader.optimalStageIteratorFunc = RB_StageIteratorSky;
2650 
2651  goto done;
2652  }
2653 
2654  if ( r_ignoreFastPath->integer )
2655  {
2656  return;
2657  }
2658 
2659  //
2660  // see if this can go into the vertex lit fast path
2661  //
2662  if ( shader.numUnfoggedPasses == 1 )
2663  {
2664  if ( stages[0].rgbGen == CGEN_LIGHTING_DIFFUSE || stages[0].rgbGen == CGEN_LIGHTING_UNIFORM || stages[0].rgbGen == CGEN_LIGHTING_DYNAMIC)
2665  {
2666  if ( stages[0].alphaGen == AGEN_IDENTITY )
2667  {
2668  if ( stages[0].bundle[0].tcGen == TCGEN_TEXTURE )
2669  {
2670  if ( !shader.polygonOffset )
2671  {
2672  if ( !shader.multitextureEnv )
2673  {
2674  if ( !shader.numDeforms )
2675  {
2676  if (vertexShaders)
2677  shader.optimalStageIteratorFunc = RB_GLSL_StageIteratorVertexLitTexture;
2678  else
2679  shader.optimalStageIteratorFunc = RB_StageIteratorVertexLitTexture;
2680 
2681  goto done;
2682  }
2683  }
2684  }
2685  }
2686  }
2687  }
2688  }
2689 
2690  //
2691  // see if this can go into an optimized LM, multitextured path
2692  //
2693  if ( shader.numUnfoggedPasses == 1 )
2694  {
2695  if ( ( stages[0].rgbGen == CGEN_IDENTITY ) && ( stages[0].alphaGen == AGEN_IDENTITY ) )
2696  {
2697  if ( stages[0].bundle[0].tcGen == TCGEN_TEXTURE &&
2698  stages[0].bundle[1].tcGen == TCGEN_LIGHTMAP )
2699  {
2700  if ( !shader.polygonOffset )
2701  {
2702  if ( !shader.numDeforms )
2703  {
2704  if ( shader.multitextureEnv )
2705  {
2706  if (vertexShaders)
2707  shader.optimalStageIteratorFunc = RB_GLSL_StageIteratorLightmappedMultitexture;
2708  else
2709  shader.optimalStageIteratorFunc = RB_StageIteratorLightmappedMultitexture;
2710 
2711  goto done;
2712  }
2713  }
2714  }
2715  }
2716  }
2717  }
2718 
2719 done:
2720  return;
2721 }
2722 
2723 typedef struct {
2724  int blendA;
2725  int blendB;
2726 
2727  int multitextureEnv;
2728  int multitextureBlend;
2729 } collapse_t;
2730 
2731 static collapse_t collapse[] = {
2732  { 0, GLS_DSTBLEND_SRC_COLOR | GLS_SRCBLEND_ZERO,
2733  GL_MODULATE, 0 },
2734

2739  GL_MODULATE, GLS_DSTBLEND_ZERO | GLS_SRCBLEND_DST_COLOR },
2740

2742  GL_MODULATE, GLS_DSTBLEND_ZERO | GLS_SRCBLEND_DST_COLOR },

2746

2755 #if 0

2757  GL_DECAL, 0 },
2758 #endif

2761 
2762 /*
2763 ================
2764 CollapseMultitexture
2765 
2766 Attempt to combine two stages into a single multitexture stage
2767 FIXME: I think modulated add + modulated add collapses incorrectly
2768 =================
2769 */
2770 static qboolean CollapseMultitexture( void ) {
2771  int abits, bbits;
2772  int i;
2773  textureBundle_t tmpBundle;
2774 
2775  if ( !qglActiveTextureARB ) {
2776  return qfalse;
2777  }
2778 
2779  // make sure both stages are active
2780  if ( !stages[0].active || !stages[1].active ) {
2781  return qfalse;
2782  }
2783 
2784  // on voodoo2, don't combine different tmus
2785  if ( glConfig.driverType == GLDRV_VOODOO ) {
2786  if ( stages[0].bundle[0].image[0]->TMU ==
2787  stages[1].bundle[0].image[0]->TMU ) {
2788  return qfalse;
2789  }
2790  }
2791 
2792  abits = stages[0].stateBits;
2793  bbits = stages[1].stateBits;
2794 
2795  // make sure that both stages have identical state other than blend modes
2796  if ( ( abits & ~( GLS_DSTBLEND_BITS | GLS_SRCBLEND_BITS | GLS_DEPTHMASK_TRUE ) ) !=
2797  ( bbits & ~( GLS_DSTBLEND_BITS | GLS_SRCBLEND_BITS | GLS_DEPTHMASK_TRUE ) ) ) {
2798  return qfalse;
2799  }
2800 
2801  abits &= ( GLS_DSTBLEND_BITS | GLS_SRCBLEND_BITS );
2802  bbits &= ( GLS_DSTBLEND_BITS | GLS_SRCBLEND_BITS );
2803 
2804  // search for a valid multitexture blend function
2805  for ( i = 0; collapse[i].blendA != -1 ; i++ ) {
2806  if ( abits == collapse[i].blendA
2807  && bbits == collapse[i].blendB ) {
2808  break;
2809  }
2810  }
2811 
2812  // nothing found
2813  if ( collapse[i].blendA == -1 ) {
2814  return qfalse;
2815  }
2816 
2817  // GL_ADD is a separate extension
2818  if ( collapse[i].multitextureEnv == GL_ADD && !glConfig.textureEnvAddAvailable ) {
2819  return qfalse;
2820  }
2821 
2822  // make sure waveforms have identical parameters
2823  if ( ( stages[0].rgbGen != stages[1].rgbGen ) ||
2824  ( stages[0].alphaGen != stages[1].alphaGen ) ) {
2825  return qfalse;
2826  }
2827 
2828  // an add collapse can only have identity colors
2829  if ( collapse[i].multitextureEnv == GL_ADD && stages[0].rgbGen != CGEN_IDENTITY ) {
2830  return qfalse;
2831  }
2832 
2833  if ( stages[0].rgbGen == CGEN_WAVEFORM )
2834  {
2835  if ( memcmp( &stages[0].rgbWave,
2836  &stages[1].rgbWave,
2837  sizeof( stages[0].rgbWave ) ) )
2838  {
2839  return qfalse;
2840  }
2841  }
2842  if ( stages[0].alphaGen == AGEN_WAVEFORM )
2843  {
2844  if ( memcmp( &stages[0].alphaWave,
2845  &stages[1].alphaWave,
2846  sizeof( stages[0].alphaWave ) ) )
2847  {
2848  return qfalse;
2849  }
2850  }
2851 
2852 
2853  // make sure that lightmaps are in bundle 1 for 3dfx
2854  if ( stages[0].bundle[0].isLightmap )
2855  {
2856  tmpBundle = stages[0].bundle[0];
2857  stages[0].bundle[0] = stages[1].bundle[0];
2858  stages[0].bundle[1] = tmpBundle;
2859  }
2860  else
2861  {
2862  stages[0].bundle[1] = stages[1].bundle[0];
2863  }
2864 
2865  // set the new blend state bits
2866  shader.multitextureEnv = collapse[i].multitextureEnv;
2867  stages[0].stateBits &= ~( GLS_DSTBLEND_BITS | GLS_SRCBLEND_BITS );
2868  stages[0].stateBits |= collapse[i].multitextureBlend;
2869 
2870  //
2871  // move down subsequent shaders
2872  //
2873  memmove( &stages[1], &stages[2], sizeof( stages[0] ) * ( MAX_SHADER_STAGES - 2 ) );
2874  Com_Memset( &stages[MAX_SHADER_STAGES-1], 0, sizeof( stages[0] ) );
2875 
2876  return qtrue;
2877 }
2878 
2879 /*
2880 =============
2881 
2882 FixRenderCommandList
2883 https://zerowing.idsoftware.com/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=493
2884 Arnout: this is a nasty issue. Shaders can be registered after drawsurfaces are generated
2885 but before the frame is rendered. This will, for the duration of one frame, cause drawsurfaces
2886 to be rendered with bad shaders. To fix this, need to go through all render commands and fix
2887 sortedIndex.
2888 ==============
2889 */
2890 static void FixRenderCommandList( int newShader ) {
2891  renderCommandList_t *cmdList = &backEndData[tr.smpFrame]->commands;
2892 
2893  if( cmdList ) {
2894  const void *curCmd = cmdList->cmds;
2895 
2896  while ( 1 ) {
2897  curCmd = PADP(curCmd, sizeof(void *));
2898 
2899  switch ( *(const int *)curCmd ) {
2900  case RC_SET_COLOR:
2901  {
2902  const setColorCommand_t *sc_cmd = (const setColorCommand_t *)curCmd;
2903  curCmd = (const void *)(sc_cmd + 1);
2904  break;
2905  }
2906  case RC_STRETCH_PIC:
2907  {
2908  const stretchPicCommand_t *sp_cmd = (const stretchPicCommand_t *)curCmd;
2909  curCmd = (const void *)(sp_cmd + 1);
2910  break;
2911  }
2912  case RC_DRAW_SURFS:
2913  {
2914  int i;
2915  drawSurf_t *drawSurf;
2916  shader_t *shader;
2917  int fogNum;
2918  int entityNum;
2919  int dlightMap;
2920  int sortedIndex;
2921  const drawSurfsCommand_t *ds_cmd = (const drawSurfsCommand_t *)curCmd;
2922 
2923  for( i = 0, drawSurf = ds_cmd->drawSurfs; i < ds_cmd->numDrawSurfs; i++, drawSurf++ ) {
2924  R_DecomposeSort( drawSurf->sort, &entityNum, &shader, &fogNum, &dlightMap );
2925  sortedIndex = (( drawSurf->sort >> QSORT_SHADERNUM_SHIFT ) & (MAX_SHADERS-1));
2926  if( sortedIndex >= newShader ) {
2927  sortedIndex++;
2928  drawSurf->sort = (sortedIndex << QSORT_SHADERNUM_SHIFT) | entityNum | ( fogNum << QSORT_FOGNUM_SHIFT ) | (int)dlightMap;
2929  }
2930  }
2931  curCmd = (const void *)(ds_cmd + 1);
2932  break;
2933  }
2934  case RC_DRAW_BUFFER:
2935  {
2936  const drawBufferCommand_t *db_cmd = (const drawBufferCommand_t *)curCmd;
2937  curCmd = (const void *)(db_cmd + 1);
2938  break;
2939  }
2940  case RC_SWAP_BUFFERS:
2941  {
2942  const swapBuffersCommand_t *sb_cmd = (const swapBuffersCommand_t *)curCmd;
2943  curCmd = (const void *)(sb_cmd + 1);
2944  break;
2945  }
2946  case RC_END_OF_LIST:
2947  default:
2948  return;
2949  }
2950  }
2951  }
2952 }
2953 
2954 /*
2955 ==============
2956 SortNewShader
2957 
2958 Positions the most recently created shader in the tr.sortedShaders[]
2959 array so that the shader->sort key is sorted reletive to the other
2960 shaders.
2961 
2962 Sets shader->sortedIndex
2963 ==============
2964 */
2965 static void SortNewShader( void ) {
2966  int i;
2967  float sort;
2968  shader_t *newShader;
2969 
2970  newShader = tr.shaders[ tr.numShaders - 1 ];
2971  sort = newShader->sort;
2972 
2973  for ( i = tr.numShaders - 2 ; i >= 0 ; i-- ) {
2974  if ( tr.sortedShaders[ i ]->sort <= sort ) {
2975  break;
2976  }
2977  tr.sortedShaders[i+1] = tr.sortedShaders[i];
2978  tr.sortedShaders[i+1]->sortedIndex++;
2979  }
2980 
2981  // Arnout: fix rendercommandlist
2982  // https://zerowing.idsoftware.com/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=493
2983  FixRenderCommandList( i+1 );
2984 
2985  newShader->sortedIndex = i+1;
2986  tr.sortedShaders[i+1] = newShader;
2987 }
2988 
2989 
2990 /*
2991 ====================
2992 GeneratePermanentShader
2993 ====================
2994 */
2995 static shader_t *GeneratePermanentShader( void ) {
2996  shader_t *newShader;
2997  int i, b;
2998  int size, hash;
2999 
3000  if ( tr.numShaders == MAX_SHADERS ) {
3001  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: GeneratePermanentShader - MAX_SHADERS hit\n");
3002  return tr.defaultShader;
3003  }
3004 
3005  newShader = ri.Hunk_Alloc( sizeof( shader_t ), h_low );
3006 
3007  *newShader = shader;
3008 
3009  if ( shader.sort <= SS_OPAQUE ) {
3010  newShader->fogPass = FP_EQUAL;
3011  } else if ( shader.contentFlags & CONTENTS_FOG ) {
3012  newShader->fogPass = FP_LE;
3013  }
3014 
3015  tr.shaders[ tr.numShaders ] = newShader;
3016  newShader->index = tr.numShaders;
3017 
3018  tr.sortedShaders[ tr.numShaders ] = newShader;
3019  newShader->sortedIndex = tr.numShaders;
3020 
3021  tr.numShaders++;
3022 
3023  for ( i = 0 ; i < newShader->numUnfoggedPasses ; i++ ) {
3024  if ( !stages[i].active ) {
3025  break;
3026  }
3027  newShader->stages[i] = ri.Hunk_Alloc( sizeof( stages[i] ), h_low );
3028  *newShader->stages[i] = stages[i];
3029 
3030  for ( b = 0 ; b < NUM_TEXTURE_BUNDLES ; b++ ) {
3031  size = newShader->stages[i]->bundle[b].numTexMods * sizeof( texModInfo_t );
3032  newShader->stages[i]->bundle[b].texMods = ri.Hunk_Alloc( size, h_low );
3033  Com_Memcpy( newShader->stages[i]->bundle[b].texMods, stages[i].bundle[b].texMods, size );
3034  }
3035  }
3036 
3037  SortNewShader();
3038 
3039  hash = generateHashValue(newShader->name, FILE_HASH_SIZE);
3040  newShader->next = hashTable[hash];
3041  hashTable[hash] = newShader;
3042 
3043  return newShader;
3044 }
3045 
3046 /*
3047 =================
3048 VertexLightingCollapse
3049 
3050 If vertex lighting is enabled, only render a single
3051 pass, trying to guess which is the correct one to best aproximate
3052 what it is supposed to look like.
3053 =================
3054 */
3055 static void VertexLightingCollapse( void ) {
3056  int stage;
3057  shaderStage_t *bestStage;
3058  int bestImageRank;
3059  int rank;
3060 
3061  // if we aren't opaque, just use the first pass
3062  if ( shader.sort == SS_OPAQUE ) {
3063 
3064  // pick the best texture for the single pass
3065  bestStage = &stages[0];
3066  bestImageRank = -999999;
3067 
3068  for ( stage = 0; stage < MAX_SHADER_STAGES; stage++ ) {
3069  shaderStage_t *pStage = &stages[stage];
3070 
3071  if ( !pStage->active ) {
3072  break;
3073  }
3074  rank = 0;
3075 
3076  if ( pStage->bundle[0].isLightmap ) {
3077  rank -= 100;
3078  }
3079  if ( pStage->bundle[0].tcGen != TCGEN_TEXTURE ) {
3080  rank -= 5;
3081  }
3082  if ( pStage->bundle[0].numTexMods ) {
3083  rank -= 5;
3084  }
3085  if ( pStage->rgbGen != CGEN_IDENTITY && pStage->rgbGen != CGEN_IDENTITY_LIGHTING ) {
3086  rank -= 3;
3087  }
3088 
3089  if ( rank > bestImageRank ) {
3090  bestImageRank = rank;
3091  bestStage = pStage;
3092  }
3093  }
3094 
3095  stages[0].bundle[0] = bestStage->bundle[0];
3096  stages[0].stateBits &= ~( GLS_DSTBLEND_BITS | GLS_SRCBLEND_BITS );
3097  stages[0].stateBits |= GLS_DEPTHMASK_TRUE;
3098  if ( shader.lightmapIndex == LIGHTMAP_NONE ) {
3099  stages[0].rgbGen = CGEN_LIGHTING_DIFFUSE;
3100  } else {
3101  stages[0].rgbGen = CGEN_EXACT_VERTEX;
3102  }
3103  stages[0].alphaGen = AGEN_SKIP;
3104  } else {
3105  // don't use a lightmap (tesla coils)
3106  if ( stages[0].bundle[0].isLightmap ) {
3107  stages[0] = stages[1];
3108  }
3109 
3110  // if we were in a cross-fade cgen, hack it to normal
3111  if ( stages[0].rgbGen == CGEN_ONE_MINUS_ENTITY || stages[1].rgbGen == CGEN_ONE_MINUS_ENTITY ) {
3112  stages[0].rgbGen = CGEN_IDENTITY_LIGHTING;
3113  }
3114  if ( ( stages[0].rgbGen == CGEN_WAVEFORM && stages[0].rgbWave.func == GF_SAWTOOTH )
3115  && ( stages[1].rgbGen == CGEN_WAVEFORM && stages[1].rgbWave.func == GF_INVERSE_SAWTOOTH ) ) {
3116  stages[0].rgbGen = CGEN_IDENTITY_LIGHTING;
3117  }
3118  if ( ( stages[0].rgbGen == CGEN_WAVEFORM && stages[0].rgbWave.func == GF_INVERSE_SAWTOOTH )
3119  && ( stages[1].rgbGen == CGEN_WAVEFORM && stages[1].rgbWave.func == GF_SAWTOOTH ) ) {
3120  stages[0].rgbGen = CGEN_IDENTITY_LIGHTING;
3121  }
3122  }
3123 
3124  for ( stage = 1; stage < MAX_SHADER_STAGES; stage++ ) {
3125  shaderStage_t *pStage = &stages[stage];
3126 
3127  if ( !pStage->active ) {
3128  break;
3129  }
3130 
3131  Com_Memset( pStage, 0, sizeof( *pStage ) );
3132  }
3133 }
3134 
3135 /*
3136 =========================
3137 FinishShader
3138 
3139 Returns a freshly allocated shader with all the needed info
3140 from the current global working shader
3141 =========================
3142 */
3143 static shader_t *FinishShader( void ) {
3144  int stage;
3145  qboolean hasLightmapStage;
3146  qboolean vertexLightmap;
3147 
3148  hasLightmapStage = qfalse;
3149  vertexLightmap = qfalse;
3150 
3151  //
3152  // set sky stuff appropriate
3153  //
3154  if ( shader.isSky ) {
3155  shader.sort = SS_ENVIRONMENT;
3156  }
3157 
3158  //
3159  // set polygon offset
3160  //
3161  if ( shader.polygonOffset && !shader.sort ) {
3162  shader.sort = SS_DECAL;
3163  }
3164 
3165  //
3166  // set appropriate stage information
3167  //
3168  for ( stage = 0; stage < MAX_SHADER_STAGES; ) {
3169  shaderStage_t *pStage = &stages[stage];
3170 
3171  if ( !pStage->active ) {
3172  break;
3173  }
3174 
3175  // check for a missing texture
3176  if ( !pStage->bundle[0].image[0] ) {
3177  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "Shader %s has a stage with no image\n", shader.name );
3178  pStage->active = qfalse;
3179  stage++;
3180  continue;
3181  }
3182 
3183  //
3184  // ditch this stage if it's detail and detail textures are disabled
3185  //
3186  if ( pStage->isDetail && !r_detailTextures->integer )
3187  {
3188  int index;
3189 
3190  for(index = stage + 1; index < MAX_SHADER_STAGES; index++)
3191  {
3192  if(!stages[index].active)
3193  break;
3194  }
3195 
3196  if(index < MAX_SHADER_STAGES)
3197  memmove(pStage, pStage + 1, sizeof(*pStage) * (index - stage));
3198  else
3199  {
3200  if(stage + 1 < MAX_SHADER_STAGES)
3201  memmove(pStage, pStage + 1, sizeof(*pStage) * (index - stage - 1));
3202 
3203  Com_Memset(&stages[index - 1], 0, sizeof(*stages));
3204  }
3205 
3206  continue;
3207  }
3208 
3209  //
3210  // default texture coordinate generation
3211  //
3212  if ( pStage->bundle[0].isLightmap ) {
3213  if ( pStage->bundle[0].tcGen == TCGEN_BAD ) {
3214  pStage->bundle[0].tcGen = TCGEN_LIGHTMAP;
3215  }
3216  hasLightmapStage = qtrue;
3217  } else {
3218  if ( pStage->bundle[0].tcGen == TCGEN_BAD ) {
3219  pStage->bundle[0].tcGen = TCGEN_TEXTURE;
3220  }
3221  }
3222 
3223 
3224  // not a true lightmap but we want to leave existing
3225  // behaviour in place and not print out a warning
3226  if (pStage->rgbGen == CGEN_VERTEX) {
3227  vertexLightmap = qtrue;
3228  }
3229 
3230 
3231 
3232  //
3233  // determine sort order and fog color adjustment
3234  //
3235  if ( ( pStage->stateBits & ( GLS_SRCBLEND_BITS | GLS_DSTBLEND_BITS ) ) &&
3236  ( stages[0].stateBits & ( GLS_SRCBLEND_BITS | GLS_DSTBLEND_BITS ) ) ) {
3237  int blendSrcBits = pStage->stateBits & GLS_SRCBLEND_BITS;
3238  int blendDstBits = pStage->stateBits & GLS_DSTBLEND_BITS;
3239 
3240  // fog color adjustment only works for blend modes that have a contribution
3241  // that aproaches 0 as the modulate values aproach 0 --
3242  // GL_ONE, GL_ONE
3243  // GL_ZERO, GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_COLOR
3244  // GL_SRC_ALPHA, GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA
3245 
3246  // modulate, additive
3247  if ( ( ( blendSrcBits == GLS_SRCBLEND_ONE ) && ( blendDstBits == GLS_DSTBLEND_ONE ) ) ||
3248  ( ( blendSrcBits == GLS_SRCBLEND_ZERO ) && ( blendDstBits == GLS_DSTBLEND_ONE_MINUS_SRC_COLOR ) ) ) {
3249  pStage->adjustColorsForFog = ACFF_MODULATE_RGB;
3250  }
3251  // strict blend
3252  else if ( ( blendSrcBits == GLS_SRCBLEND_SRC_ALPHA ) && ( blendDstBits == GLS_DSTBLEND_ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA ) )
3253  {
3254  pStage->adjustColorsForFog = ACFF_MODULATE_ALPHA;
3255  }
3256  // premultiplied alpha
3257  else if ( ( blendSrcBits == GLS_SRCBLEND_ONE ) && ( blendDstBits == GLS_DSTBLEND_ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA ) )
3258  {
3259  pStage->adjustColorsForFog = ACFF_MODULATE_RGBA;
3260  } else {
3261  // we can't adjust this one correctly, so it won't be exactly correct in fog
3262  }
3263 
3264  // don't screw with sort order if this is a portal or environment
3265  if ( !shader.sort ) {
3266  // see through item, like a grill or grate
3267  if ( pStage->stateBits & GLS_DEPTHMASK_TRUE ) {
3268  shader.sort = SS_SEE_THROUGH;
3269  } else {
3270  shader.sort = SS_BLEND0;
3271  }
3272  }
3273  }
3274 
3275  stage++;
3276  }
3277 
3278  // there are times when you will need to manually apply a sort to
3279  // opaque alpha tested shaders that have later blend passes
3280  if ( !shader.sort ) {
3281  shader.sort = SS_OPAQUE;
3282  }
3283 
3284  //
3285  // if we are in r_vertexLight mode, never use a lightmap texture
3286  //
3287  if ( stage > 1 && ( (r_vertexLight->integer && !r_uiFullScreen->integer) || glConfig.hardwareType == GLHW_PERMEDIA2 ) ) {
3288  VertexLightingCollapse();
3289  stage = 1;
3290  hasLightmapStage = qfalse;
3291  }
3292 
3293  //
3294  // look for multitexture potential
3295  //
3296  if ( stage > 1 && CollapseMultitexture() ) {
3297  stage--;
3298  }
3299 
3300  if ( shader.lightmapIndex >= 0 && !hasLightmapStage ) {
3301  if (vertexLightmap) {
3302  ri.Printf( PRINT_DEVELOPER, "WARNING: shader '%s' has VERTEX forced lightmap!\n", shader.name );
3303  } else {
3304  ri.Printf( PRINT_DEVELOPER, "WARNING: shader '%s' has lightmap but no lightmap stage!\n", shader.name );
3305  shader.lightmapIndex = LIGHTMAP_NONE;
3306  }
3307  }
3308 
3309 
3310  //
3311  // compute number of passes
3312  //
3313  shader.numUnfoggedPasses = stage;
3314 
3315  // fogonly shaders don't have any normal passes
3316  if (stage == 0 && !shader.isSky)
3317  shader.sort = SS_FOG;
3318 
3319  // determine which stage iterator function is appropriate
3320  ComputeStageIteratorFunc();
3321 
3322  return GeneratePermanentShader();
3323 }
3324 
3325 //========================================================================================
3326 
3327 /*
3328 ====================
3329 FindShaderInShaderText
3330 
3331 Scans the combined text description of all the shader files for
3332 the given shader name.
3333 
3334 return NULL if not found
3335 
3336 If found, it will return a valid shader
3337 =====================
3338 */
3339 static char *FindShaderInShaderText( const char *shadername ) {
3340 
3341  char *token, *p;
3342 
3343  int i, hash;
3344 
3345  hash = generateHashValue(shadername, MAX_SHADERTEXT_HASH);
3346 
3347  for (i = 0; shaderTextHashTable[hash][i]; i++) {
3348  p = shaderTextHashTable[hash][i];
3349  token = COM_ParseExt(&p, qtrue);
3350  if ( !Q_stricmp( token, shadername ) ) {
3351  return p;
3352  }
3353  }
3354 
3355  p = s_shaderText;
3356 
3357  if ( !p ) {
3358  return NULL;
3359  }
3360 
3361  // look for label
3362  while ( 1 ) {
3363  token = COM_ParseExt( &p, qtrue );
3364  if ( token[0] == 0 ) {
3365  break;
3366  }
3367 
3368  if ( !Q_stricmp( token, shadername ) ) {
3369  return p;
3370  }
3371  else {
3372  // skip the definition
3373  SkipBracedSection( &p );
3374  }
3375  }
3376 
3377  return NULL;
3378 }
3379 
3380 
3381 /*
3382 ==================
3383 R_FindShaderByName
3384 
3385 Will always return a valid shader, but it might be the
3386 default shader if the real one can't be found.
3387 ==================
3388 */
3389 shader_t *R_FindShaderByName( const char *name ) {
3390  char strippedName[MAX_QPATH];
3391  int hash;
3392  shader_t *sh;
3393 
3394  if ( (name==NULL) || (name[0] == 0) ) {
3395  return tr.defaultShader;
3396  }
3397 
3398  COM_StripExtension(name, strippedName, sizeof(strippedName));
3399 
3400  hash = generateHashValue(strippedName, FILE_HASH_SIZE);
3401 
3402  //
3403  // see if the shader is already loaded
3404  //
3405  for (sh=hashTable[hash]; sh; sh=sh->next) {
3406  // NOTE: if there was no shader or image available with the name strippedName
3407  // then a default shader is created with lightmapIndex == LIGHTMAP_NONE, so we
3408  // have to check all default shaders otherwise for every call to R_FindShader
3409  // with that same strippedName a new default shader is created.
3410  if (Q_stricmp(sh->name, strippedName) == 0) {
3411  // match found
3412  return sh;
3413  }
3414  }
3415 
3416  return tr.defaultShader;
3417 }
3418 
3419 
3420 /*
3421 ===============
3422 R_FindShader
3423 
3424 Will always return a valid shader, but it might be the
3425 default shader if the real one can't be found.
3426 
3427 In the interest of not requiring an explicit shader text entry to
3428 be defined for every single image used in the game, three default
3429 shader behaviors can be auto-created for any image:
3430 
3431 If lightmapIndex == LIGHTMAP_NONE, then the image will have
3432 dynamic diffuse lighting applied to it, as apropriate for most
3433 entity skin surfaces.
3434 
3435 If lightmapIndex == LIGHTMAP_2D, then the image will be used
3436 for 2D rendering unless an explicit shader is found
3437 
3438 If lightmapIndex == LIGHTMAP_BY_VERTEX, then the image will use
3439 the vertex rgba modulate values, as apropriate for misc_model
3440 pre-lit surfaces.
3441 
3442 Other lightmapIndex values will have a lightmap stage created
3443 and src*dest blending applied with the texture, as apropriate for
3444 most world construction surfaces.
3445 
3446 ===============
3447 */
3448 shader_t *R_FindShader( const char *name, int lightmapIndex, qboolean mipRawImage ) {
3449  char strippedName[MAX_QPATH];
3450  int i, hash;
3451  char *shaderText;
3452  image_t *image;
3453  shader_t *sh;
3454 
3455  if ( name[0] == 0 ) {
3456  return tr.defaultShader;
3457  }
3458 
3459  // use (fullbright) vertex lighting if the bsp file doesn't have
3460  // lightmaps
3461  if ( lightmapIndex >= 0 && lightmapIndex >= tr.numLightmaps ) {
3462  lightmapIndex = LIGHTMAP_BY_VERTEX;
3463  } else if ( lightmapIndex < LIGHTMAP_2D ) {
3464  // negative lightmap indexes cause stray pointers (think tr.lightmaps[lightmapIndex])
3465  ri.Printf( PRINT_WARNING, "WARNING: shader '%s' has invalid lightmap index of %d\n", name, lightmapIndex );
3466  lightmapIndex = LIGHTMAP_BY_VERTEX;
3467  }
3468 
3469  COM_StripExtension(name, strippedName, sizeof(strippedName));
3470 
3471  hash = generateHashValue(strippedName, FILE_HASH_SIZE);
3472 
3473  //
3474  // see if the shader is already loaded
3475  //
3476  for (sh = hashTable[hash]; sh; sh = sh->next) {
3477  // NOTE: if there was no shader or image available with the name strippedName
3478  // then a default shader is created with lightmapIndex == LIGHTMAP_NONE, so we
3479  // have to check all default shaders otherwise for every call to R_FindShader
3480  // with that same strippedName a new default shader is created.
3481  if ( (sh->lightmapIndex == lightmapIndex || sh->defaultShader) &&
3482  !Q_stricmp(sh->name, strippedName)) {
3483  // match found
3484  return sh;
3485  }
3486  }
3487 
3488  // make sure the render thread is stopped, because we are probably
3489  // going to have to upload an image
3490  if (r_smp->integer) {
3491  R_SyncRenderThread();
3492  }
3493 
3494  // clear the global shader
3495  Com_Memset( &shader, 0, sizeof( shader ) );
3496  Com_Memset( &stages, 0, sizeof( stages ) );
3497  Q_strncpyz(shader.name, strippedName, sizeof(shader.name));
3498  shader.lightmapIndex = lightmapIndex;
3499  for ( i = 0 ; i < MAX_SHADER_STAGES ; i++ ) {
3500  stages[i].bundle[0].texMods = texMods[i];
3501  }
3502 
3503  // FIXME: set these "need" values apropriately
3504  shader.needsNormal = qtrue;
3505  shader.needsST1 = qtrue;
3506  shader.needsST2 = qtrue;
3507  shader.needsColor = qtrue;
3508 
3509  //
3510  // attempt to define shader from an explicit parameter file
3511  //
3512  shaderText = FindShaderInShaderText( strippedName );
3513  if ( shaderText ) {
3514  // enable this when building a pak file to get a global list
3515  // of all explicit shaders
3516  if ( r_printShaders->integer ) {
3517  ri.Printf( PRINT_ALL, "*SHADER* %s\n", name );
3518  }
3519 
3520  if ( !ParseShader( &shaderText ) ) {
3521  // had errors, so use default shader
3522  shader.defaultShader = qtrue;
3523  }
3524  sh = FinishShader();
3525  return sh;
3526  }
3527 
3528 
3529  //
3530  // if not defined in the in-memory shader descriptions,
3531  // look for a single supported image file
3532  //
3533  image = R_FindImageFile( name, mipRawImage, mipRawImage, mipRawImage ? GL_REPEAT : GL_CLAMP_TO_EDGE );
3534  if ( !image ) {
3535  ri.Printf( PRINT_DEVELOPER, "Couldn't find image file for shader %s\n", name );
3536  shader.defaultShader = qtrue;
3537  return FinishShader();
3538  }
3539 
3540  //
3541  // create the default shading commands
3542  //
3543  if ( shader.lightmapIndex == LIGHTMAP_NONE ) {
3544  // dynamic colors at vertexes
3545  stages[0].bundle[0].image[0] = image;
3546  stages[0].active = qtrue;
3547  stages[0].rgbGen = CGEN_LIGHTING_DIFFUSE;
3548  stages[0].stateBits = GLS_DEFAULT;
3549  } else if ( shader.lightmapIndex == LIGHTMAP_BY_VERTEX ) {
3550  // explicit colors at vertexes
3551  stages[0].bundle[0].image[0] = image;
3552  stages[0].active = qtrue;
3553  stages[0].rgbGen = CGEN_EXACT_VERTEX;
3554  stages[0].alphaGen = AGEN_SKIP;
3555  stages[0].stateBits = GLS_DEFAULT;
3556  } else if ( shader.lightmapIndex == LIGHTMAP_2D ) {
3557  // GUI elements
3558  stages[0].bundle[0].image[0] = image;
3559  stages[0].active = qtrue;
3560  stages[0].rgbGen = CGEN_VERTEX;
3561  stages[0].alphaGen = AGEN_VERTEX;
3562  stages[0].stateBits = GLS_DEPTHTEST_DISABLE |
3563  GLS_SRCBLEND_SRC_ALPHA |
3564  GLS_DSTBLEND_ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA;
3565  } else if ( shader.lightmapIndex == LIGHTMAP_WHITEIMAGE ) {
3566  // fullbright level
3567  stages[0].bundle[0].image[0] = tr.whiteImage;
3568  stages[0].active = qtrue;
3569  stages[0].rgbGen = CGEN_IDENTITY_LIGHTING;
3570  stages[0].stateBits = GLS_DEFAULT;
3571 
3572  stages[1].bundle[0].image[0] = image;
3573  stages[1].active = qtrue;
3574  stages[1].rgbGen = CGEN_IDENTITY;
3575  stages[1].stateBits |= GLS_SRCBLEND_DST_COLOR | GLS_DSTBLEND_ZERO;
3576  } else {
3577  // two pass lightmap
3578  stages[0].bundle[0].image[0] = tr.lightmaps[shader.lightmapIndex];
3579  stages[0].bundle[0].isLightmap = qtrue;
3580  stages[0].active = qtrue;
3581  stages[0].rgbGen = CGEN_IDENTITY; // lightmaps are scaled on creation
3582  // for identitylight
3583  stages[0].stateBits = GLS_DEFAULT;
3584 
3585  stages[1].bundle[0].image[0] = image;
3586  stages[1].active = qtrue;
3587  stages[1].rgbGen = CGEN_IDENTITY;
3588  stages[1].stateBits |= GLS_SRCBLEND_DST_COLOR | GLS_DSTBLEND_ZERO;
3589  }
3590 
3591  return FinishShader();
3592 }

3600 
3601  // probably not necessary since this function

3700 
3701 /*
3702 ====================
3703 RE_RegisterShader
3704 
3705 This is the exported shader entry point for the rest of the system
3706 It will always return an index that will be valid.
3707 
3708 This should really only be used for explicit shaders, because there is no
3709 way to ask for different implicit lighting modes (vertex, lightmap, etc)
3710 ====================
3711 */
3712 qhandle_t RE_RegisterShaderLightMap( const char *name, int lightmapIndex ) {
3713  shader_t *sh;
3714 
3715  if ( strlen( name ) >= MAX_QPATH ) {
3716  ri.Printf( PRINT_ALL, "Shader name exceeds MAX_QPATH\n" );
3717  return 0;
3718  }
3719 
3720  sh = R_FindShader( name, lightmapIndex, qtrue );
3721 
3722  // we want to return 0 if the shader failed to
3723  // load for some reason, but R_FindShader should
3724  // still keep a name allocated for it, so if
3725  // something calls RE_RegisterShader again with
3726  // the same name, we don't try looking for it again
3727  if ( sh->defaultShader ) {
3728  return 0;
3729  }
3730 
3731  return sh->index;
3732 }
3733

3735 /*
3736 ====================
3737 RE_RegisterShader
3738 
3739 This is the exported shader entry point for the rest of the system
3740 It will always return an index that will be valid.
3741 
3742 This should really only be used for explicit shaders, because there is no
3743 way to ask for different implicit lighting modes (vertex, lightmap, etc)
3744 ====================
3745 */
3746 qhandle_t RE_RegisterShader( const char *name ) {
3747  shader_t *sh;
3748 
3749  if ( strlen( name ) >= MAX_QPATH ) {
3750  ri.Printf( PRINT_ALL, "Shader name exceeds MAX_QPATH\n" );
3751  return 0;
3752  }
3753 
3754  sh = R_FindShader( name, LIGHTMAP_2D, qtrue );
3755 
3756  // we want to return 0 if the shader failed to
3757  // load for some reason, but R_FindShader should
3758  // still keep a name allocated for it, so if
3759  // something calls RE_RegisterShader again with
3760  // the same name, we don't try looking for it again
3761  if ( sh->defaultShader ) {
3762  return 0;
3763  }
3764 
3765  return sh->index;
3766 }
